trans-unit.source: Most of the time authentication errors result from incorrect or inconsistent configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: Most of the time authentication errors result from incorrect or inconsistent configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Here are some specific suggestions for things to check.
trans-unit.target: Here are some specific suggestions for things to check.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you didn't miss the **Save** button anywhere.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you didn't miss the **Save** button anywhere.

trans-unit.source: This is often easy to do, and the result is that you'll be looking at the correct values on a portal page but they haven't actually been saved in the Azure environment or Azure AD application.
trans-unit.target: This is often easy to do, and the result is that you'll be looking at the correct values on a portal page but they haven't actually been saved in the Azure environment or Azure AD application.

trans-unit.source: For settings configured in the **Application Settings** blade of the Azure portal, make sure that the correct API app or web app was selected when the settings were entered.
trans-unit.target: For settings configured in the **Application Settings** blade of the Azure portal, make sure that the correct API app or web app was selected when the settings were entered.

trans-unit.source: Also make sure that the settings were entered as **App settings** and not **Connection strings**, as the format of the two sections is similar.
trans-unit.target: Also make sure that the settings were entered as **App settings** and not **Connection strings**, as the format of the two sections is similar.

trans-unit.source: For authentication to a JavaScript front end, download the manifest again to verify that `oauth2AllowImplicitFlow` was successfully changed to `true`.
trans-unit.target: For authentication to a JavaScript front end, download the manifest again to verify that `oauth2AllowImplicitFlow` was successfully changed to `true`.

trans-unit.source: Verify that you used HTTPS wherever you configured URLs:
trans-unit.target: Verify that you used HTTPS wherever you configured URLs:

trans-unit.source: In project code
trans-unit.target: In project code

trans-unit.source: In CORS
trans-unit.target: In CORS

trans-unit.source: In Azure environment App settings for each API app and web app
trans-unit.target: In Azure environment App settings for each API app and web app

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD application settings.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD application settings.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you copy an API app's URL from the portal, it often has `http://` and you have to manually change it to `https://`.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you copy an API app's URL from the portal, it often has `http://` and you have to manually change it to `https://`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that any code changes were successfully deployed.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that any code changes were successfully deployed.

trans-unit.source: For example, in a multiple-project solution it's possible to change a project's code and accidentally choose one of the others when you intend to deploy the change.
trans-unit.target: For example, in a multiple-project solution it's possible to change a project's code and accidentally choose one of the others when you intend to deploy the change.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are going to HTTPS URLs in your browser, not HTTP URLs.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are going to HTTPS URLs in your browser, not HTTP URLs.

trans-unit.source: By default, Visual Studio creates publish profiles with HTTP URLs, and that's what opens in the browser after you deploy a project.
trans-unit.target: By default, Visual Studio creates publish profiles with HTTP URLs, and that's what opens in the browser after you deploy a project.

trans-unit.source: For authentication to a JavaScript front end, make sure that CORS is correctly configured on the API app that the JavaScript code calls.
trans-unit.target: For authentication to a JavaScript front end, make sure that CORS is correctly configured on the API app that the JavaScript code calls.

trans-unit.source: If in doubt about whether the problem is CORS-related, try "*" as the allowed origin URL.
trans-unit.target: If in doubt about whether the problem is CORS-related, try "*" as the allowed origin URL.

trans-unit.source: For a JavaScript front end, open your browser's Developer Tools Console tab to get more error information, and examine HTTP requests on the Network.
trans-unit.target: For a JavaScript front end, open your browser's Developer Tools Console tab to get more error information, and examine HTTP requests on the Network.

trans-unit.source: However, Console error messages may be misleading.
trans-unit.target: However, Console error messages may be misleading.

trans-unit.source: If you get a message indicating a CORS error, the real issue may be authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you get a message indicating a CORS error, the real issue may be authentication.

trans-unit.source: You can check if this is the case by running the app with authentication temporarily temporarily disabled.
trans-unit.target: You can check if this is the case by running the app with authentication temporarily temporarily disabled.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET API app, make sure you are getting as much information in error messages as possible by setting [customErrors mode to Off](../app-service-web/web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remoteview).
trans-unit.target: For a .NET API app, make sure you are getting as much information in error messages as possible by setting [customErrors mode to Off](../app-service-web/web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remoteview).

trans-unit.source: For a .NET API app, start a [remote debugging session](../app-service-web/web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remotedebug), and examine the values of the variables that are passed to code that uses ADAL to acquire a bearer token, or code that checks claims against the expected service principal ID.
trans-unit.target: For a .NET API app, start a [remote debugging session](../app-service-web/web-sites-dotnet-troubleshoot-visual-studio.md#remotedebug), and examine the values of the variables that are passed to code that uses ADAL to acquire a bearer token, or code that checks claims against the expected service principal ID.

trans-unit.source: Note that your code can pick up configuration values from many different sources, so it's possible to find surprises this way.
trans-unit.target: Note that your code can pick up configuration values from many different sources, so it's possible to find surprises this way.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you mistype `ida:ClientId` as `ida:ClientID` when configuring Azure App Service environment settings, the code might get the `ida:ClientId` value that it's looking for from the Web.config file, ignoring the Azure App Service setting.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you mistype `ida:ClientId` as `ida:ClientID` when configuring Azure App Service environment settings, the code might get the `ida:ClientId` value that it's looking for from the Web.config file, ignoring the Azure App Service setting.

trans-unit.source: If things don't work in a normal Internet Explorer window, an existing log-in may be interfering; try InPrivate and try Chrome or Firefox.
trans-unit.target: If things don't work in a normal Internet Explorer window, an existing log-in may be interfering; try InPrivate and try Chrome or Firefox.
